text: To investigate the mechanism by which CVB3 induces G1 arrest, cells were infected with CVB3 (MOI = 1) for 24 h, the protein levels of Hsp70, cyclin E, and p27 kip1 were determined by Western blotting. In the cells infected with CVB3, Hsp70, and p27 Kip1 were markedly increased, while cyclin E was decreased ( Figures 6A,B) . These data show that the dysregulated Hsp70, cyclin E, and p27 Kip1 contribute to G1 arrest induced by CVB3 infection. These data also imply that VP1 at least contributes to G1 arrest during CVB3 infection.
